item.text: In the second year of the reign of Israel’s King Joash son of Joahaz, Joash’s son Amaziah became king over Judah.

He <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st>-<st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he <st data-num="04427" class="">began to reign</st>, and he <st data-num="04427" class="">reigned</st> for <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st>-<st data-num="08672" class="">nine</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" /> His <st data-num="08034 0517">mother</st><n id="2" /> was <st data-num="03086" class="">Jehoaddan</st>, who was <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.
He did what the Lord approved, but not like David his ancestor had done. He followed the example of his father Joash.
But the high places were not eliminated; the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense on the high places.
When he had secured control of the kingdom, he executed the servants who had assassinated his father.

But he did not execute the sons of the assassins. He obeyed the Lord’s commandment as recorded in the scroll of the law of Moses, “Fathers must not be put to death for what their sons do, and sons must not be put to death for what their fathers do. A man must be put to death only for his own sin.”
He defeated 10,000 Edomites in the Salt Valley; he captured Sela in battle and renamed it Joktheel, a name it has retained to this very day.

<st data-num="0227" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="04397" class="">messengers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03060" class="">Jehoash</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03059" class="">Jehoahaz</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03058" class="">Jehu</st>, <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>. He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Come</st>, let’s <st data-num="07200" class="">meet</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">face</st> to face.”<n id="1" />

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03060" class="">Jehoash</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> this <st data-num="0559" class="">message</st> back <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, “A <st data-num="02336 0834">thornbush</st> in <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> this <st data-num="0559" class="">message</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> a <st data-num="0730 0834">cedar</st> in <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st>, ‘<st data-num="05414" class="">Give</st> your <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> to my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> as a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>.’ Then a <st data-num="07704" class="">wild</st> <st data-num="02416 0834">animal</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">came by</st> and <st data-num="07429" class="">trampled down</st> the <st data-num="02336" class="">thorn</st>.<n id="2" />

You <st data-num="05221" class="">thoroughly</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st>,<n id="1" /> and it has <st data-num="05375" class="">gone</st> to your <st data-num="03820" class="">head</st>!<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03513" class="">Gloat</st> over your success,<n id="3" /> but <st data-num="03427" class="">stay</st> in your <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>. <st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> <st data-num="01624" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">calamity</st> on yourself? Why <st data-num="05307" class="">bring down</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">yourself</st> and <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">along with</st> you?”<n id="4" />

But <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah</st> would <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heed</st> the warning,<n id="1" /> so <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03060" class="">Jehoash</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">attacked</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> and <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">met</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">face</st> to face<n id="3" /> in <st data-num="01053 0834">Beth Shemesh</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>.

<st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> was <st data-num="05062" class="">defeated</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">by</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, and each <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="05127" class="">ran back</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">home</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03060" class="">Jehoash</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="08610" class="">captured</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03060" class="">Jehoash</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0274" class="">Ahaziah</st>, in <st data-num="01053" class="">Beth Shemesh</st>. He<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0935" class="">attacked</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> and <st data-num="06555" class="">broke down</st> the <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st> of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> from the <st data-num="08179" class="">Gate</st> of <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06438" class="">Corner</st> <st data-num="08179" class="">Gate</st>—a distance of about <st data-num="0702 03967 0520">600 feet</st>.<n id="3" />
He took away all the gold and silver, all the items found in the Lord’s temple and in the treasuries of the royal palace, and some hostages. Then he went back to Samaria.

The <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="01697" class="">events</st> of <st data-num="03060" class="">Jehoash’s</st><n id="1" /> reign, including all his <st data-num="0834 06213">accomplishments</st> and his <st data-num="01369" class="">successful</st> <st data-num="0834 03898">war</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, <st data-num="03808 01992">are</st> <st data-num="03789" class="">recorded</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st> called the <st data-num="01697 03117">Annals</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">Kings</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.<n id="2" />
Jehoash passed away and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. His son Jeroboam replaced him as king.
King Amaziah son of Joash of Judah lived for 15 years after the death of King Jehoash son of Jehoahaz of Israel.

The <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="01697" class="">events</st> of <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah’s</st> reign <st data-num="03808 01992">are</st> <st data-num="03789" class="">recorded</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st> called the <st data-num="01697 03117">Annals</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">Kings</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="07195" class="">Conspirators</st> <st data-num="07194" class="">plotted</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> him in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>,<n id="1" /> so he <st data-num="05127" class="">fled</st> to <st data-num="03923" class="">Lachish</st>. But they <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> assassins <st data-num="0310 03923">after</st> him,<n id="2" /> and they <st data-num="04191" class="">killed</st> him <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.

His body was <st data-num="05375" class="">carried back</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st>,<n id="1" /> and he was <st data-num="06912" class="">buried</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">City</st> of <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="05838" class="">Azariah</st>, <st data-num="01931" class="">who</st> was <st data-num="08337 06240">sixteen</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st>, and <st data-num="04427" class="">made</st> him <st data-num="04427" class="">king</st> in his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah’s</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">place</st>.
Azariah built up Elat and restored it to Judah after the king had passed away.
In the fifteenth year of the reign of Judah’s King Amaziah son of Joash, Jeroboam son of Joash became king over Israel. He reigned for 41 years in Samaria.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord; he did not repudiate the sinful ways of Jeroboam son of Nebat who encouraged Israel to sin.

He restored the border of Israel from Lebo Hamath in the north to the sea of the rift valley in the south, just as in the message from the Lord God of Israel that he had announced through his servant Jonah son of Amittai, the prophet from Gath Hepher.
The Lord saw Israel’s intense suffering; everyone was weak and incapacitated and Israel had no deliverer.
The Lord had not decreed that he would blot out Israel’s memory from under heaven, so he delivered them through Jeroboam son of Joash.

The rest of the events of Jeroboam’s reign, including all his accomplishments, his military success in restoring Israelite control over Damascus and Hamath, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Jeroboam passed away and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. His son Zechariah replaced him as king.
